1222//            "    return vec3(lab.x, length(vec2(lab.y,lab.z)), atan(lab.z, lab.y));\n" +
1223            "}\n" +
1224            "vec3 lab2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
1225            "{\n" +
1226//            "    c = vec3(c.x, cos(c.z) * c.y, sin(c.z) * c.y);\n" +
1227            "    float lg = 1./1.16*(c.x + 0.16);\n" +
1228            "    vec3 xyz = vec3(xyzR(lg + c.y * 0.2),\n" +
1229            "                    xyzR(lg),\n" +
1230            "                    xyzR(lg - c.z * 0.5));\n" +
1231            "    vec3 rgb = xyz*mat3( 3.2406, -1.5372,-0.4986,\n" +
1232            "                        -0.9689,  1.8758, 0.0415,\n" +
1233            "                         0.0557, -0.2040, 1.0570);\n" +
1234            "    return rgb;\n" +
1235            "}\n" +
1236            "void main()\n" +
1237            "{\n" +
1238            "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1239            "  vec3 lab = rgb2lab(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
1240            "  lab.x = lab.x + v_color.r - 0.5372549;\n" +
1241            "  lab.yz = lab.yz + (v_color.gb - 0.5) * 2.0;\n" +
1242            "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(lab2rgb(lab), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1243            "}";
1244
1245    /**
1246     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1247     * batch color, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the batch color, and can be
1248     * gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. This uses an RGB batch color for simpler usage in most code that
1249     * doesn't already use colorful-gdx. There is some contribution from the original texture, so even if the batch
1250     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors. I hope this shader is... bearable.
1251     * <br>
1252     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1253     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1254     * <br>
1255     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1256     */
1257    public static String fragmentShaderColorize =
1258            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1259                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1260                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1261                    "#else\n" +
1262                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1263                    "#endif\n" +
1264                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1265                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1266                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1267                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1268                    "void main()\n" +
1269                    "{\n" +
1270                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1271                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1272                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1273                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1274                    "  vec3 tint = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1275                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1276                    "              * (v_color.rgb * v_color.rgb), forward);\n" +
1277                    "  tint.x = clamp(base.x, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1278                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1279                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1280                    "  tint.yz = clamp(tint.yz * (0.7 + blen) + base.yz * (0.3 - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" + // change 0.7 and 0.3 to, say, 0.85 and 0.15 to reduce the original image's contribution
1281                    "  tint = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * tint;\n" +
1282                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1283                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1284                    "                 (tint * tint * tint)," +
1285                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1286                    "}";
1287
1288    /**
1289     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1290     * batch color's chromatic channels, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the
1291     * batch color, and can be gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. The lightness of the batch color is used
1292     * to determine how strong the effect should be; you may want to use an out-of-gamut color for very strong tint
1293     * effects, because those need to be light and the lightest gamut is just one point. This uses an Oklab batch color.
1294     * There is some contribution from the original texture, varied based on the batch lightness, so even if the batch
1295     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors.
1296     * <br>
1297     * You can generate Oklab colors using any of various methods in the {@code oklab} package, such as
1298     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab.ColorTools#oklab(float, float, float, float)}.
1299     * <br>
1300     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1301     */
1302    public static String fragmentShaderColorizeOklab =
1303            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1304                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1305                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1306                    "#else\n" +
1307                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1308                    "#endif\n" +
1309                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1310                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1311                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1312                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1313                    "void main()\n" +
1314                    "{\n" +
1315                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1316                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1317                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1318                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1319                    "  vec2 tint = v_color.gb - 0.5;\n" +
1320                    "  base.x = clamp(base.x, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1321                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1322                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1323                    "  base.gb = clamp(tint * (v_color.r + blen) + base.yz * (1.0 - v_color.r - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1324                    "  base = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * base;\n" +
1325                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1326                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1327                    "                 (base * base * base)," +
1328                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1329                    "}";
1330    /**
1331     * The simplest possible color-inverting shader for a SpriteBatch, this just takes each RGB channel and subtracts it
1332     * from 1.0 to get the value this uses. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1333     * <br>
1334     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1335     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1336     * <br>
1337     * Meant only for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1338     */
1339    public static final String fragmentShaderInvertedRGB =
1340            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1341                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1342                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1343                    "#else\n" +
1344                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1345                    "#endif\n" +
1346                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1347                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1348                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1349                    "void main()\n" +
1350                    "{\n" +
1351                    "   vec4 tgt = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n" +
1352                    "   gl_FragColor = vec4(1.0 - tgt.rgb * v_color.rgb, v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1353                    "}";
1354
1355    /**
1356     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedRGB}, but internally converts to Oklab, so it can invert just lightness
1357     * without changing color hue or saturation. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1358     * <br>
1359     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1360     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1361     * <br>
1362     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1363     */
1364    public static String fragmentShaderInvertedLightness =
1365            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1366                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1367                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1368                    "#else\n" +
1369                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1370                    "#endif\n" +
1371                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1372                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1373                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1374                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1375                    "float toOklab(float L) {\n" +
1376                    "  return (L - 1.0) / (1.0 - L * 0.4285714) + 1.0;\n" +
1377                    "}\n" +
1378                    "float fromOklab(float L) {\n" +
1379                    "  return (L - 1.0) / (1.0 + L * 0.75) + 1.0;\n" +
1380                    "}\n" +
1381                    "void main()\n" +
1382                    "{\n" +
1383                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1384                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1385                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1386                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1387                    "  lab.x = fromOklab(1.0 - toOklab(lab.x));\n" +
1388                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1389                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1390                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1391                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1392                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1393                    "}";
1394
1395    /**
1396     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedLightness}, but instead of inverting lightness, this tries to change only
1397     * hue, without changing lightness or (generally) saturation. This works internally by negating the A and B
1398     * components of the color (as Oklab). This uses an RGBA batch color.
1399     * <br>
1400     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1401     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1402     * <br>
1403     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1404     */
1405    public static String fragmentShaderInvertedChroma =
1406            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1407                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1408                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1409                    "#else\n" +
1410                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1411                    "#endif\n" +
1412                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1413                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1414                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1415                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1416                    "void main()\n" +
1417                    "{\n" +
1418                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1419                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1420                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1421                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1422                    "  lab.yz = -lab.yz;\n" +
1423                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1424                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1425                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1426                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1427                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1428                    "}";
1429
1430}
